articles.title: WPK Greets People's Party of Cambodia
articles.content:
WPK Greets People's Party of Cambodia
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) Saturday sent a message of greeting to the Central Committee of the People's Party of Cambodia on the 64th anniversary of its founding.
					 The message expressed belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two parties would develop on good terms in the future, too, wishing the People's Party of Cambodia greater success in its activities for achieving the country's prosperity and national unity.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Sends Message of Sympathy to Emir of Kuwait
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Sends Message of Sympathy to Emir of Kuwait
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Saturday sent a message of sympathy to Sabah Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah, emir of the State of Kuwait, as regards a recent suicide bomb strike on a Shiite Muslim mosque of Kuwait that claimed casualties.
					 The message said that it is the consistent and firm stand of the DPRK government to oppose all sorts of terrorism and any support to it and the DPRK strongly condemns the terrorist act in Kuwait.
					
					 It reaffirmed the invariable support and solidarity of the DPRK for the emir, friendly government and people of Kuwait for achieving the stability of the country and national unity.

articles.title: Kang Sok Ju Meets Cuban FM
articles.content:
Kang Sok Ju Meets Cuban FM
  Havana, June 26 (KCNA) -- Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) who is on a visit to Cuba, Friday met and had a talk with Cuban Foreign Minister Bruno Rodriguez Parrilla.
					  Present there were members of the WPK delegation, Pak Chang Yul, DPRK ambassador to the DPRK, Oscar Martinez Cordoves, deputy head of the International Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, and officials concerned of the foreign ministry.
					
					  At the meeting the foreign minister said that Cuba attaches weighty importance to the friendly relations between the two countries provided by Fidel Castro Ruz and President Kim Il Sung and will invariably develop them.
					
					 He highly praised the Korean people for making remarkable achievements under the wise guidance of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					  Cuba will maintain the socialist principle under the present situation, he stressed. 
					
					 The delegation visited different places in Havana including the Cuban Revolution Museum.

articles.title: DPRK Will Never Pardon Park Geun Hye Group's Provocation: CPRK Secretariat
articles.content:
DPRK Will Never Pardon Park Geun Hye Group's Provocation: CPRK Secretariat
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- The Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea (CPRK) issued its information bulletin No. 1097 on Saturday denouncing the south Korean puppet group for kicking off the racket for confrontation with the DPRK. It said:
					 On June 26 the Park Geun Hye group blustered that it would opt for "stronger pressure" to "allure the north to change", revealing independent "financial sanctions on the north".
					
					 Though the DPRK government in a statement clarified the will for improving the inter-Korean relations, the puppet group is keen to intensify military tie-ups with the U.S. and Japanese masters, while vociferating about "nuclear threat from the north" and "human rights issue" almost every day. The puppet group including Park Geun Hye, the puppet prime minister and the foreign minister claimed that "north's nukes will bring isolation and sanctions only" and it is "anachronistic", malignantly slandering the DPRK's line of simultaneously developing the two fronts.
					
					 With the June 25 Korean war as a momentum, the puppet military warmongers once again test-fired ballistic missile aimed at "striking the whole of the north" and introduced U.S. nuclear submarine Michigan to Pusan, opening its interior. Recently, they dared bluster that they would turn "concept for operating military muscle" into the orientation to mount preemptive strike at core facilities of the north.
					
					 Such confrontational racket kicked off by the Park group is a heinous one blatantly challenging the principled stand of the DPRK and a treacherous crime driving the north-south relations into the uncontrollable worst phase.
					
					 The situation prevailing on the Korean peninsula is reaching a hair-raising crisis of war due to the reckless moves of the puppet group.
					
					 The DPRK will not pardon the provocative moves of the Park group deliberately foiling the inter-Korean relations and inciting a war fever in order to attain its despicable political purpose but sternly punish it in the name of the entire nation. Provokers will face merciless punishment and miserable ruin.

articles.title: French Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
French Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- A delegation of French business people led by Alban Yung, Chinese representative of the "Foundation of Victor Segalen" in France, visited Mangyongdae, birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 At the old home in Mangyongdae where the President was born and spent his childhood, nurturing his great intention to make the Korean revolution the members of the delegation looked round with keen interest the historic relics preserved there, being briefed on touching stories about the time-honored home.
					
					 The delegation also toured the e-library and swimming gymnasium of Kim Il Sung University.

articles.title: French Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
French Delegation Leaves
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- A delegation of French business people led by Alban Yung, Chinese representative of the "Foundation of Victor Segalen" in France, left here Saturday.

articles.title: Mongolian Friendship Delegation Departs
articles.content:
Mongolian Friendship Delegation Departs
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- A friendship delegation of the Department for the Diplomatic Corps Service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Mongolia led by Director Otgonbayar Zayamandakh left here for home Saturday.

articles.title: Officials of Lenin Young Communist League Tour Mt. Paektu Area
articles.content:
Officials of Lenin Young Communist League Tour Mt. Paektu Area
 Samjiyon, June 27 (KCNA) -- Officials and members of the Lenin Young Communist League of the Russian Federation toured the Mt. Paektu area from June 25 to 27.
					 They laid bouquets before the statue of President Kim Il Sung on the shore of Lake Samji and paid tribute to him.
					
					 They visited leader Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the Paektusan Secret Camp.
					
					 They placed bunches of flowers before the mosaic depicting the three commanders of Mt. Paektu in the secret camp and paid tribute to them.
					
					 At the time-honored old home of Kim Jong Il, they were briefed on the fact that he grew to be the son of guerrillas.
					
					 They climbed Mt. Paektu. At dawn they enjoyed bird's-eye views of the grandiose mountain, Lake Chon, mysterious rocks and cliffs and beautiful glow.
					
					 They also visited the Pochonbo Revolutionary Battle Site, Chongbong Bivouac, Konchang Bivouac and Rimyongsu Falls.

articles.title: U.S. Accused of Abusing Signboard of UN to Eliminate DPRK
articles.content:
U.S. Accused of Abusing Signboard of UN to Eliminate DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Saturday in an article cites facts that the U.S. imperialists had made long careful preparations for justifying the Korean War under the signboard of the UN.
					 After provoking the Korean war the U.S. imperialists got more frantic with the moves to abuse the UN signboard, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. imperialists cooked up resolutions of the UN Security Council one after another in order to cover up the truth behind the Korean war which the U.S. ignited according to the carefully worked out scenario for a war against the DPRK.
					
					 First of all, they fabricated a resolution of the UNSC in a bid to pass the buck for the outbreak of the Korean war to the DPRK.
					
					 Then they cooked up a resolution for hurling "UN forces" into the Korean war. 
					
					 According to such illegal resolutions of the UNSC the U.S. secured a pretext for massively hurling aggressor forces into the Korean war and painted its war of aggression in Korea as a "defensive one" being fought by the UN in line with its mission. 
					
					 The truth behind the outbreak of the Korean war clearly proves that it was none other than the U.S. which defamed the UN in wanton violation of the UN Charter. 
					
					 The U.S. made desperate efforts to eliminate the DPRK by abusing the signboard of the UN but it suffered a bitter defeat in face of the heroic Korean people, leaving disgrace in its history. 
					
					 Nevertheless, the U.S. is busy cooking up lots of "issues" and making desperate efforts to isolate and stifle the DPRK under the signboard of the UN still now. 
					
					 Nothing is more foolish than the calculation of the U.S. that its aggressive and burglarious methods dating back to 1950 will work even at present.

articles.title: DPRK Will Mercilessly Punish Those Hurting Its Dignity and Social System; Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
DPRK Will Mercilessly Punish Those Hurting Its Dignity and Social System; Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- The UN "office on human rights in the north" appeared in Seoul on June 23 under the auspices of the south Korean puppet forces.
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					The setting up of the "office" in south Korea which deserves international monitoring and sanctions before any region for being a human rights tundra is an unpardonable mockery of justice and truth and intolerable insult to the inviolable human rights.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is the fact that the puppet forces took such action in June marking the 15th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					
					 The above-said farce clearly proves that the Park Geun Hye group remains unchanged in its black-hearted intention to escalate the confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north and  the group's cunning and vicious nature goes far beyond that of the preceding dictators.
					
					 The puppet forces' hosting of such "office" for confrontation in Seoul which no country in the world dared do is as a foolish an act as planting a time bomb in their house.
					
					 The DPRK solemnly warned that the "office" would become the target of merciless strike by the DPRK the moment it is open.
					
					 Dialogue and improved relations between the north and the south can hardly be imaginable as long as the confrontation maniacs are dreaming of doing harm to the sovereignty and socialist system in the DPRK in utter disregard of the destiny of the nation and the prospect of the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 It is the steadfast will and determination of the DPRK to mercilessly punish those who are keen to hurt its dignity and social system.

articles.title: Drill for Preemptive Attack on North Kicked Off in South Korea
articles.content:
Drill for Preemptive Attack on North Kicked Off in South Korea
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- S. Korean puppet warmongers announced that they would kick off a regiment-scale joint landing drill in waters off Anmyon Island in the West Sea of Korea from June 25 to July 5, according to south Korean Yonhap News.
					 The landing drill was reported to involve thousands of troops, dozens of warships including large transports, Aegis destroyer, submarine and landing craft and 45 aircrafts belonging to the ground, sea and air forces of the south Korean puppet army.
					
					The madcap rehearsals for surprise preemptive attack upon the north will include naval maneuver of landing forces, advance troops operation for destroying the defenses before landing and naval bombardment and air support operations.
					
					 The warmongers are mulling staging rehearsals for landing both on the front and in the rear of targeted coast simultaneously under the naval and air cover on June 29, the crucial phase of the drill.

articles.title: Korean in China Demands Immediate Pullback of U.S. Forces from S. Korea
articles.content:
Korean in China Demands Immediate Pullback of U.S. Forces from S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- Cha Sang Bo, vice-chairman of the General Association of Koreans in China, made public a statement on June 23 denouncing the U.S. imperialists for having brought only misfortune and pain to the Korean people for several decades.
					 The Korean war clearly proved that the U.S. imperialists are the chieftain of aggression and war and sworn enemy of the Korean people, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 History and reality patently proved that the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet forces are chiefly to blame for harassing peace and security on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 Peace and reunification on the peninsula can never be achieved and the Koreans can hardly escape the disaster of a nuclear war unless the presence of the cursed U.S. imperialist aggressor troops in south Korea is terminated.
					
					 Now is the time for all Koreans truly concerned over the destiny of the nation and desirous of peace and reunification to turn out in a nation-wide struggle to deal sledge-hammer blows at the U.S. imperialists keen to bring the dark clouds of a nuclear war to hang over the peninsula and the puppet group of traitors bent on escalating the confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north.
					
					 The U.S. should stop acting rashly, properly understanding the spirit of Songun Korea, and unconditionally withdraw its troops from south Korea.
					
					 If the U.S. imperialists ignite another war, oblivious of the lesson drawn from their past defeat, the service personnel of the heroic Korean People's Army and people of the DPRK will give full play to the invincible might of the powerful revolutionary Paektusan army and make a clean sweep of the aggressors from this land and thus surely achieve the historic cause of national reunification, the cherished desire of the Koreans.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted by Swiss Organization on Its Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted by Swiss Organization on Its Website
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "Giving Priority to Ideological Work Is Essential for Accomplishing Socialism" was posted by the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea on its website on June 19.
					 The work, published on June 19, Juche 84 (1995), says that in order to successfully accomplish the socialist cause it is important to hold fast to the ideological work and give priority to it in all matters.
					
					 It also clarifies the ideas that the basic task of the ideological work is to dye the whole society with the socialist idea and that the ideological work should be conducted according to the principles and methods suited to the intrinsic requirements of socialism.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Germany
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Germany
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering President Kim Il Sung was inaugurated in Germany on June 22.
					 The chairman of the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee set the remembrance period from June 22 to July 8 and decided to organize a seminar, film show and other political and cultural events.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Foreigners
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Foreigners
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- Events were held in foreign countries from June 16 to 20 to mark the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 They included a meeting and book and photo exhibition in the UK, round-table talks in India and meeting in Pakistan.
					
					 Displayed in the exhibition were photos dealing with the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Books and photos introducing the DPRK were also on show.
					
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the New Communist Party of Britain said that Kim Jong Il performed undying exploits, adhering to the revolutionary principle in party building and activities since he started the work at the WPK Central Committee, prompted by his noble responsibility for the Korean revolution.
					
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the Revolutionary Communist Party of Britain (Marxist-Leninist) said the WPK could demonstrate its dignity despite the hostile forces' challenges and rapidly changing world political situation as it held Kim Jong Il in high esteem.
					
					 A member of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) who doubles as secretary general of All India Indo-Korean Friendship Association and other speakers noted the exploits Kim Jong Il performed in party building and activities would shine forever together with socialist Korea.

articles.title: Important Days of DPRK to Be Marked in South Africa
articles.content:
Important Days of DPRK to Be Marked in South Africa
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- A South African preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversaries of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea and Korea's liberation was inaugurated on June 18.
					 The secretary of a region of the African National Congress of South Africa was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set the celebration period from June 18 to October 15 and decided to widely introduce the immortal exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and successes being achieved by the Korean people in building a thriving socialist nation under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un and organize a meeting, seminar, film show and other political and cultural events.

articles.title: Important Day of DPRK Observed by Foreign Papers
articles.content:
Important Day of DPRK Observed by Foreign Papers
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- Cuban and Uruguayan newspapers carried special write-ups on the occasion of the 15th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 The Cuban newspaper Granma in an article on June 18 said that June 15 this year marks the 15th anniversary of the adoption of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration by Kim Jong Il, leader of the DPRK.
					
					 Korea has been divided into the north and the south by foreign forces after World War II, the article said, and went on:
					
					 The 1950-1953 Korean war has not yet ended.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung set forth the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo in 1980.
					
					 The DPRK is making positive efforts to reunify Korea according to the federal formula.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Un devoted his all to national reunification true to the intentions of the preceding leaders.
					
					 The Uruguayan newspaper La Juventud on June 13 carried an article titled "By Our Nation Itself" illustrated with a photo of the Monument to the Three Charters for National Reunification.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days to Be Marked in Pakistan
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days to Be Marked in Pakistan
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- A Pakistani national preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversaries of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea and the liberation of Korea was inaugurated in Karachi on June 21.
					 Amar Jit Malhotra, former senator of Pakistan, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to widely introduce the immortal exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and organize colorful events for supporting the just cause of the Korean people to build a thriving nation and reunify the country from August 1 to October 10.
					
					 A letter to supreme leader Kim Jong Un was adopted at the inaugural ceremony.

articles.title: June 15 North-South Joint Declaration Supported by Foreign Political Party, Bodies
articles.content:
June 15 North-South Joint Declaration Supported by Foreign Political Party, Bodies 
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- Political party and bodies of different countries posted articles on their websites on June 14 and 15 on the occasion of the 15th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 The German Communist Party said in an article titled "June 15 North-South Joint Declaration" that the north-south summit, the first of its kind in the history of Korea's division, was provided and the grand June 15 era of reunification was opened thanks to leader Kim Jong Il's patriotic bold decision. 
					
					 The way of improving the north-south relations is to implement the joint declaration, the article noted.
					
					 The Society for the Promotion of the Relations between Austria and the DPRK posted an article titled "Let's open up a broad avenue to independent reunification" under the headline "On the occasion of the 15th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration" illustrated with Kim Jong Il's photo.
					
					 The France-Korea Friendship Association in an article lauded Kim Jong Il for providing the historic June 15 joint declaration and great hope and prospect for the reunification of Korea.
					
					 The article went on:
					
					 The joint declaration is the driving force of the mutual understanding and the improvement of relations between the north and the south as it reflects the unanimous will of the Korean people hoping for peace and reunification.
					
					 On the occasion of the 15th anniversary of the joint declaration we call for approaching with realistic judgment the issues arising in achieving the cause of Korea's reunification and settling the reunification issue in the spirit of the joint declaration.

articles.title: MINREX denuncia difamacion anti-RPDC de Estados Unidos
articles.content:
MINREX denuncia difamacion anti-RPDC de Estados Unidos
Pyongyang, 27 de junio (ACNC) --  A la pregunta de un reportero de la ACNC formulada en relacion con que ultimamente, el Departamento de Estado norteamericano volvio a difamar la digna RPDC al publicar el llamado "reporte anual de DDHH", el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea dio la vispera la siguiente respuesta:
					El dia 25, el asistente del secretario para democracia, derechos humanos y trabajo del susodicho departamento hablo del "cambio" de la RPDC cuestionando con malignidad el llamado "problema de DDHH" de ella en una rueda de prensa especial.
					
					Sus palabras revelaron una vez mas el malsano intento de EE.UU. de lograr, cueste lo que cueste, su ambicion de derrumbar el regimen socialista a estilo coreano centrado en las masas populares bajo el vistoso rotulo de la "defensa de DDHH".
					
					No le agradaria a Estados Unidos preso del arraigado veto y la hostilidad a la RPDC, el verdadero aspecto del socialismo mas ventajoso en este mundo en que todas las personas llevan una vida dichosa gozando a sus anchas de la libertad y derechos politicos verdaderos.
					
					El pais norteamericano esta sonando con que podria ocurrir algun "cambio" en el interior de la RPDC, lo cual significa coger con la mano la nube.
					
					Se intensificara por todos medios el poderio militar de la RPDC y el pueblo coreano gozara de todas las felicidades del socialismo. Esto sera el cambio que experimentara el pais norteamericano.
					
					Dado que EE.UU. sigue recurriendo a la politica hostil anti-RPDC, esta tambien tomara las contramedidas intransigentes para frustrarlo.
					
					El mundo vera claramente como la RPDC frustra las maquinaciones de aislamiento y aplastamiento anti-RPDC de Estados Unidos.
